page.title: 03Local History (B)
page.content: Jean Watson was a servant in a large house called Whitehill of Keppoch in Cardross. She was accused of stealing a piece of tongue from her master so she ran away from the house. She reached the swollen burn of Auchenfroe which she tried to cross. She nearly drowned but eventually made it, reaching London. There she married a shipbroker named Moore. She became wealthy and sent money for a bridge to be built in Cardross over the burn. Today the bridge can be seen with two special stones in it. On one is inscribed the motto of Cardross,{"Not {we, but God."} The other bears the armorials of the Montgomery family.
